steps.notes: Mine mare regolith from surface
Screen and separate size fractions
Crush and grind coarse regolith to powder
Extract oxygen and produce metal byproduct via MRE

recipe_def.assumptions: Co-product metal alloy from MRE; refining not modeled.
recipe_def.notes: Coarse route; add refining/separation later.

steps.notes: Cast metal for structural frame
Machine and finish structural frame

recipe_def.assumptions: Simple ISRU route using regolith metal; 5% casting loss, 5% machining loss
recipe_def.notes: ISRU variant using regolith_metal_crude from regolith. Enables local production of structural frames.

recipe_def.assumptions: Cast shell to ~net shape; subsequent finishing operations to be modeled later.
recipe_def.notes: Cast shell from metal alloy_bulk; finishing/machining not modeled yet.
recipe_def.name: Mill shell generic production

steps.notes: Collection of carbonaceous chondrite regolith from meteorite impact sites. Rare (1-2% of lunar surface) but critical for carbon and volatile extraction. Slower than generic mining due to site prospecting and travel.

recipe_def.notes:
Collection process for carbonaceous regolith from CM/CI chondrite impact sites.
Targets areas with visible dark material enrichment and organic compound signatures.
Rich in carbon (2-5%), water (10%), and volatiles - essential for ISRU operations.

steps.notes: Extract carbon reductant from carbonaceous regolith feedstock.

recipe_def.assumptions: Carbonaceous regolith feedstock available for small-scale carbon recovery.
recipe_def.notes: ISRU extraction route for carbon reductant; drying and sizing steps deferred.
Bootstrap Highlands regolith supply via simple mining process.

steps.notes: Extract ilmenite from regolith; yields generated in process.

recipe_def.assumptions: Extraction yields ~0.6 kg ilmenite per 1 kg regolith input; tailings ~0.4 kg.
recipe_def.notes: In-situ ilmenite extraction from regolith; placeholder yields and mass balance.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for ilmenite extraction from regolith

steps.notes: Single-step carbothermal reduction from ore to iron pig/ingot.

recipe_def.notes: Direct path from iron ore/ilmenite to iron_pig_or_ingot using the iron_smelting_reduction_v0 process.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for iron pig or ingot

recipe_def.assumptions: Feedstock is pig iron (iron_pig_or_ingot); steel_refining_basic_v0 outputs a billet/slab and slag.
recipe_def.notes: Casting/refining a pig iron feed into steel billet or slab. Uses basic refining/casting furnaces.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for steel billet or slab v0

steps.notes: Hot or cold roll steel billet into bar stock

recipe_def.notes: Steel bar raw production via rolling mill. Converts steel billet/slab into bar stock for machining.

recipe_def.assumptions: Pig iron to steel ingot via refining to billet/slab then casting to ingot.
recipe_def.notes: Simplified steel ingot production path.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for steel ingot v0

steps.notes: Hot roll steel ingot into bar or billet shapes

recipe_def.assumptions: Semi-finished steel product from hot rolling of ingots. Standard stock sizes for machining and forging feedstock.
recipe_def.notes: Production of steel bar and billet stock from ingots. Processing time ~1.5 hours per kg. ~5% loss to scale and trim.

inputs.notes: Steel billet for rolling into bar stock

Carbothermic path step producing silicon metal from regolith silica

recipe_def.notes: Form steel motor housing from iron. 19.2 kg iron  18 kg housing + 1.2 kg scrap.

steps.notes: Forge rough blank from steel stock bar or billet to approximate shaft shape
Turn and bore to bearing journals and keyway features
Final tolerances and surface finish on shaft bearing surfaces

recipe_def.assumptions: Use steel stock bar or billet; final motor shaft geometry matches journal and keyway specs; tolerances defined by machining_finish_basic_v0
recipe_def.notes: Basic motor shaft manufacturing path; adjust as design details are refined

steps.notes: Reduce ilmenite/ore with carbon to produce pig iron feedstock.
Refine pig iron and cast billets/slabs for rolling.
Hot roll billets into bar/plate/rod stock and cut to length.

recipe_def.assumptions: Local steel route using carbothermal iron reduction, basic refining, and hot rolling; energy/time are best-guess placeholders.
recipe_def.notes: Replaces import placeholder for general steel stock feed used across machining and fabrication.

steps.notes: Cast fastener blanks and washer stock in batch molds
Machine threads and washer profiles from cast blanks
Heat treat fasteners for strength and spring properties
Inspect heat-treated fasteners for hardness and dimensional checks
Sort fasteners by size (M6, M8, M10, M12), count, and kit

recipe_def.assumptions:
Simplified fastener manufacturing from metal alloy bulk to finished kit:
- Cast blanks for bolts, nuts, and washers
- Machine threads and profiles
- Heat treat for strength and spring properties
- Final inspection and kitting

Input materials: 2.0 kg steel_stock
Output: 1.0 kg complete fastener kit per BOM specification
Scrap rate: ~50% from casting/machining losses (conservative placeholder)
recipe_def.notes:
Simplified local recipe for fastener_kit_medium production.

Kit composition per bom_fastener_kit_medium_v0:
- 720g hex bolts M6-M12 in various lengths (76 pieces total)
- 180g hex nuts M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 75g flat washers M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 30g lock washers M6-M12 (60 pieces total)
Total: ~366 fasteners, 1.0 kg net weight

Manufacturing process details:
1. Casting: Form blanks for bolts, nuts, and washers
2. Threading: Cut external threads on bolts, tap nuts
3. Heat treatment: Quench and temper bolts to grade 8.8 equivalent, harden lock washers
4. Inspection: Verify hardness and dimensional checks
5. Kitting: Sort by size, verify counts, package in compartmented container
References detailed specification in design/memos/fastener_kit_specification.md
Most commonly used fastener kit in the KB (107 BOMs reference this item)

steps.notes: Cast gearbox housing from cast iron, machine bearing bores and shaft seals to precise tolerances, final inspection and preparation for assembly

recipe_def.assumptions: 70 kg cast gearbox housing for medium gearbox.
recipe_def.notes: Three-step recipe for cast gearbox housing.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for gearbox housing cast

inputs.notes: Steel stock for gear blanks; ~8% machining loss

outputs.notes: Medium gear set after cutting and finishing

steps.notes: Machine gear blanks from steel bar stock and cut gear teeth

inputs.notes: Steel stock for gear blanks; ~8% machining loss

outputs.notes: Medium gear set after cutting and finishing

recipe_def.assumptions: Generic medium-sized gear set; gear cutting covers blank machining and tooth cutting; heat treatment optional
recipe_def.notes:
Production of medium gear set from steel bar stock.

Process:
1. Cut gear blanks from steel bar stock (lathe/mill)
2. Cut gear teeth (gear hobbing or milling)
3. Heat treat for hardness (optional, depends on application)
4. Finish and inspect

Mass: ~60 kg finished gears from 65 kg steel stock (8% machining loss)

steps.notes: Cast shaft blanks from steel, precision machine shaft journals and gear seats, final inspection and pairing

recipe_def.assumptions: 30 kg shaft set for gearbox; multiple shafts.
recipe_def.notes: Three-step recipe for gearbox shaft set.

steps.notes: Cast bearing races and rolling elements from bearing steel
Machine and heat treat bearing components to HRC 58-64
Precision grind races and rolling elements to final tolerances
Assemble bearings with cage, lubricate, seal, and test

recipe_def.assumptions: Heavy-duty bearing set (4 kg) for large motors and machinery; precision ground races and rolling elements; heat-treated to bearing-grade hardness; includes lubrication and final testing.
recipe_def.notes: Comprehensive 13-step recipe covering steel processing, precision machining, ball/roller forming, heat treatment, assembly, lubrication, and testing. Suitable for 70-100mm bore heavy industrial bearings.

steps.notes: Cast reservoir and fittings
Machine connection threads
Assemble pack with filter and lubricant

recipe_def.assumptions: 5 kg lubrication pack for gearbox applications.
recipe_def.notes: Three-step recipe for basic lubrication pack.

steps.notes: Cast housing and gear blanks, cut gear teeth to specification, machine shafts and bearing bores, assemble gearbox with bearings and lubrication

recipe_def.assumptions: 110 kg medium gear reducer assembled from pre-fabricated components including cast housing, machined gears, and shafts
recipe_def.notes: Assembly of medium gearbox reducer for power transmission applications

steps.notes: Stamp stator/rotor laminations from electrical steel sheet (40 kg  38 kg)
Wind aluminum coils for medium motor (28.4 kg wire + insulation  27 kg coils)
Assemble motor from laminations, coils, housing, shaft, bearings, and fasteners

recipe_def.assumptions:
90 kg medium drive motor for automated machinery.

Material requirements (total ~92.4 kg input):
- Electrical steel sheet: 40 kg (for laminations)
- Aluminum wire: 28.4 kg (for windings)
- Coil insulation: 1.4 kg (imported or produced)
- Motor housing steel: 15 kg
- Motor shaft steel: 5 kg
- Bearing set heavy: 4 kg
- Fastener kit medium: 1 kg

Output: 1 drive_motor_medium unit (90 kg nominal) + ~2.4 kg scrap/loss

This recipe uses the proven processes from motor_electric_small production
but scaled up for the larger motor size.
recipe_def.notes:
Three-step recipe for medium electric drive motor using detailed process flows.

Replaces recipe_drive_motor_medium_v0 which used placeholder processes.

Total production time: ~19 hours
- Lamination stamping: 2 hr
- Coil winding: 13 hr (precision work)
- Final assembly and test: 4 hr

ISRU potential: 96% by mass (only coil insulation imported)

steps.notes: Cast machine base, column, and table from cast iron for vibration damping and rigidity (total ~600-800 kg castings)
Precision machine all mating surfaces, linear guide ways, spindle housing bore, and mounting surfaces; scrape ways to precision tolerances (0.005 mm)
Fabricate and weld structural support frame, coolant tank, chip guard, and enclosure panels
Install linear guides and ball screws on X/Y/Z axes, mount servo motors and encoders, install spindle assembly with bearings, integrate coolant system
Wire CNC controller to servo drives and motors, install limit switches and home sensors, integrate spindle control and tool changer, connect operator panel
Align axes for perpendicularity and parallelism (within 0.01 mm), level machine base, adjust backlash in ball screws
Program test toolpaths, verify axis motion and positioning accuracy, test spindle operation and tool changing, run test parts
Calibrate axes using laser interferometer or precision gauge blocks, tune servo parameters for optimal performance
Verify positioning accuracy (0.01-0.02 mm), repeatability, surface finish capability, and safety interlocks

recipe_def.assumptions: CNC milling machine for automated precision machining. 1200 kg system with cast iron base/column/table for rigidity. 3-axis (X/Y/Z) motion control with ball screws and linear guides. Spindle speeds 100-10,000+ RPM, power 3-7.5 kW. Travel typically 500x400x400 mm. Includes CNC controller (3+ axis), servo motors with encoders, automatic tool changer (optional), coolant system, and chip guard. Positioning accuracy 0.01-0.02 mm.
recipe_def.notes: Assembly of CNC milling machine. Total fabrication time ~155 hours. Extensive precision machining of base components, complex mechanical and electrical integration, and rigorous alignment/calibration required. Critical machine tool for precision manufacturing and prototyping. Much more complex than manual milling machine due to CNC control system and automated features.
